properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 2 at 9:02PM PST until February 3 at 10:31PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Washington...

Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County
Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County
Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County
Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County
White River 10 N R Street Bridge affecting King and Pierce Counties
Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County
Skagit River Near Mt. Vernon affecting Skagit County


A weak front crosses Western Washington tonight, but falls apart
Monday morning. Dry conditions then return for a short time late
Monday morning through the day. This mostly dry period will allow
local rivers to continue to recede.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Skokomish River At Potlatch
* Until Monday evening.
* At  8:30 PM Sunday the stage was 16.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river has crested and will continue to fall to below
flood stage Monday early afternoon.
* Impact...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread
flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West
Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
